raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Coherent (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does System maintain coherence and a good flow of conversation throughout the dialogue?
- A float score near 1 (not coherent) means that System's responses are unrelated to the conversation topic and may disrupt or confuse the flow of the dialogue.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat coherent) means that System's responses are partially related to the conversation topic but may not be clear or direct.
- A float score near 3 (very coherent) means that System's responses are closely related to the conversation topic and contribute to maintaining a smooth dialogue.


Conversations to be evaluated:



Sample1:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello!
User: Have you had lunch yet?
System: Yes I've eaten
User: Cool. Where and what did you eat?
System: I ate about an hour ago and had a sandwich the rain didn't make me want to travel far haha
User: A sandwich for lunch? Was it filling. I'm currently having some mix of shrimp, fish, chicken and pork. I'm considering going vegetarian though. Lol.

Sample2:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello! How's it going?
User: It's going pretty well. Thanks for asking.
System: That's good! What are you up to?
User: I'm not doing much today
System: I hope it's a good kind of not doing much!
User: haha, I don't know about that
System: Well, I hope it's at least fun.
User: I just need to relax
System: Relaxing is good.
User: What are you doing?
System: I'm just hanging out and listening to music.
User: what kind of music do you like?
System: I'm listening to a band called The Devil Wears Prada right now.
User: never heard about them

Sample3:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! How are you doing today?
User: I'm doing great how are you??
System: I'm doing good. Just having some morning tea
User: are you a tea person or do you like coffee too?
System: I'm really a hot chocolate person. I don't drink coffee and I only drink tea when I'm trying to be healthy and want something warm to drink. What about you?
User: I love hot chocolate. Have you ever had european style hot chocolate? It's kind of like drinking melted chocolate bars haha
System: I recently tried it for the first time and you're right - it had a wonderful melted chocolate bar taste! I tried it up in a place in San Francisco and they had delicious homemade marshmallows too!
User: that's great. It's so cold these nights. Right setting for hot coco. Do you have anything you enjoy doing during cold times?
System: Traveling to warm places haha. When it's cold, you appreciate the warm climate more :) If I am not traveling, then I prefer there to be snow on the ground so I can go skiing or tubing down the mountain. What about you?
User: I tuck in blankets and read a book lol. I have never done tubing, but I seen some people do it. Is it worth it if you already ski?
System: Skiing involves a lot of muscle - especially in the legs so it is a workout. Tubing, you just sit and enjoy the ride down. Also with tubing, you can chain with your friends and go down together whereas with skiing, you're trying to not run into your friends.
User: hahaha that's a great way to put it

Sample4:

Conversation History:

System: Hello! What's up?
User: sky is up
System: No, it's night time.
User: so where does the sky go in the night?
System: It goes wherever it wants to.
User: that doesn't make sense. How can sky go anywhere?
System: It doesn't have to make sense.
User: why?
System: Because it doesn't have to.
User: you are very abstract. Something bothering you?
System: Nope. I'm fine.
User: You really don't seem so. You can tell me what's going on?
System: I'm just fine.
User: ok. wanna go out to eat dessert?
System: I'm not hungry.
User: Okay, I am heading out now

Sample5:

Conversation History:

User: Sure, I will love to invite you and your family for a meal over the holidays. Have you guys made any other plans?

Sample8:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello there!
User: How's your day going?
System: I've seen better days, how about you?
User: I'm good I'm good. What's getting you down?
System: The clouds overhead are playing on your mind, any plans for the coming vacations?
User: I'm thinking of going to visit my family. How about you?
System: Was thinking the same, where does your family live?
User: They're in New York. How about yours?
System: Mine is in India, it is a long way away.
User: Ahh what city? I've visited India before.
System: Hyderabad, it is a beautiful city in the southern part of India. Which cities have you gone to in India?
User: Hyderabad! and Bangalore! Great food in both cities! Is it still hot this time of year?

Sample9:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey! How are you today?
User: Good! Have you seen the movie 'The Iron Giant', it's one my favorite movies
System: Yes! I love that movie!
User: it's the best. Which part do you like the most?
System: Honestly, I love the whole movie.
User: Brad Bird is an amazing director. I worked with him on "Incredibles 2"
System: Really? That's awesome! What do you do?
User: I"m a REDACTED_TERM and REDACTED_TERM. I basically help design the characters that you see in the movies
System: That's awesome! That's pretty cool.
User: yup! Maybe one day you can be one of those cool characters yourself!
System: That would be the coolest.
User: What do you want to be later on in your life?
System: I want to own my own business.
User: cool! what kind?
System: An art gallery or bookstore.
User: My mom had a similar dream. Of owning a coffee shop somewhere in Mexico
System: That would be nice. I like coffee.
User: She loves people and a place where they can get together
System: That's very sweet. What does she do?
User: Currently she's a real-estate agent
System: That's very interesting. Does she enjoy being a real estate agent?
User: I think so!! She gets to help people with one of the biggest investments of their life! Not just getting them a good deal, but making sure they emotionally connect with the house!

Sample10:

Conversation History:

User: do you follow technology news?

User: I think so
System: Well thinking may not be one of your strong points...hehehe!
User: whoa rude

raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Coherent (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does System maintain coherence and a good flow of conversation throughout the dialogue?
- A float score near 1 (not coherent) means that System's responses are unrelated to the conversation topic and may disrupt or confuse the flow of the dialogue.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat coherent) means that System's responses are partially related to the conversation topic but may not be clear or direct.
- A float score near 3 (very coherent) means that System's responses are closely related to the conversation topic and contribute to maintaining a smooth dialogue.


Conversations to be evaluated:



Sample1:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello!
User: Have you had lunch yet?
System: Yes I've eaten
User: Cool. Where and what did you eat?
System: I ate about an hour ago and had a sandwich the rain didn't make me want to travel far haha
User: A sandwich for lunch? Was it filling. I'm currently having some mix of shrimp, fish, chicken and pork. I'm considering going vegetarian though. Lol.

User: haha, I don't know about that

Sample3:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! How are you doing today?
User: I'm doing great how are you??
System: I'm doing good. Just having some morning tea
User: are you a tea person or do you like coffee too?
System: I'm really a hot chocolate person. I don't drink coffee and I only drink tea when I'm trying to be healthy and want something warm to drink. What about you?
User: I love hot chocolate. Have you ever had european style hot chocolate? It's kind of like drinking melted chocolate bars haha
System: I recently tried it for the first time and you're right - it had a wonderful melted chocolate bar taste! I tried it up in a place in San Francisco and they had delicious homemade marshmallows too!
User: that's great. It's so cold these nights. Right setting for hot coco. Do you have anything you enjoy doing during cold times?
System: Traveling to warm places haha. When it's cold, you appreciate the warm climate more :) If I am not traveling, then I prefer there to be snow on the ground so I can go skiing or tubing down the mountain. What about you?
User: I tuck in blankets and read a book lol. I have never done tubing, but I seen some people do it. Is it worth it if you already ski?
System: Skiing involves a lot of muscle - especially in the legs so it is a workout. Tubing, you just sit and enjoy the ride down. Also with tubing, you can chain with your friends and go down together whereas with skiing, you're trying to not run into your friends.
User: hahaha that's a great way to put it
